data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Martha Ray Barnett Braddock
data.text:
Martha Ray Barnett Braddock, 92, lifelong resident of the Ripley Community and wife of the late R.L. Braddock, passed away Thursday evening December 15, 2016 at Baptist Memorial Hospital in New Albany following a brief illness.

Services for Mrs. Braddock will be at 2 PM Saturday, December 17 in The Heritage Chapel of Ripley Funeral Home with Bro. Bill Connolly, retired Pastor of Ripley Presbyterian Church, officiating. Burial will follow in Ripley Cemetery. Arrangements will be provided by The Ripley Funeral Home.

A native of Tippah County, Mrs. Braddock was born April, 28, 1924, the daughter of the late William Roy and Zelda Ray Barnett. She was a 1940 graduate of Ripley High School and was married to R. L. Braddock, a longtime State Farm Insurance Agent in Tippah County who preceded her in death in 1977.

Mrs. Braddock was a homemaker throughout her life and was a devoted member of the Ripley Presbyterian Church for many years. She had been a resident of The Magnolia Place Retirement Center in New Albany for the past 4 years.

Mrs. Braddock developed a lasting bond with many friends during her lifetime and received much pleasure in traveling and playing Bridge. An artist, she will be remembered as a person who enjoyed painting as long as health permitted.

A visitation for family and friends will be from 1 PM until 2 PM Saturday at The Ripley Funeral Home.

She is survived by her daughter, Sheila Schwartzmann of New Orleans, LA, her brother, William Roy Barnett, Jr. (Joyce) of Olive Branch, 3 grandchildren, Adrian Schwartzmann III, Heidi Schwartzmann and Cassie Schwartzman, all of New Orleans.

Mrs. Braddock was preceded in death by her son, William Lee Braddock of Ripley and her son in law, Adrian Schwartzmann II of New Orleans.

The family request memorials be directed to Ripley Presbyterian Church, PO Box 556, Ripley, MS 38663.
